definition: to rob the rich to help the poor
variant of 劫[jie2]
variant of 劫[jie2]
variant of 劫[jie2]
to rob/to plunder/to seize by force/to coerce/calamity/abbr. for kalpa 劫波[jie2 bo1]
rich/abundant/wealthy
surname Fu
to cross a river/to aid or relieve/to be of help
only used in 濟濟|济济[ji3 ji3]
used in place names associated with the Ji River 濟水|济水[Ji3 Shui3]/surname Ji
poor/inadequate/deficient/garrulous

sentences.english: Redistributing wealth from the rich to the poor only reduces the wealth of both groups, but particularly of the poor.
sentences.chinese: 而劫富济贫会使双方的财富都减少，特别是穷人。

sentences.english: In their minds, is the Robin Hood-like bandit hero.
sentences.chinese: 在他们的头脑里，强盗就是劫富济贫的英雄好汉。

sentences.english: In their eyes, the robber is maxi-cans good example.
sentences.chinese: 在他们眼里，强盗就是劫富济贫的好榜样。

sentences.english: And why would Robin Hood want to rob them to help the poor?
sentences.chinese: 又是为什么罗宾汉要劫富济贫呢？

sentences.english: Robin hood and his men robbed the rich to help the poor.
sentences.chinese: 罗宾汉和他的伙伴们劫富济贫。

definition: to root out the strong and support the weak (idiom); to rob the rich and give to the poor
to help the poor
true hero of Greenwood (refers to popular hero in Robin Hood style)
to be chivalrous
robbing the rich to help the poor
to break into a house for robbery (idiom)
lit. to intervene when one sees an injustice (idiom)/fig. to rush to the rescue/to play the white knight
pinyin: lu4 jian4 bu4 ping2 , ba2 dao1 xiang1 zhu4

definition: to help the needy for justice (idiom); to be loyal to one's friends and generous to the needy
knight/swordsman/noble warrior/chivalrous hero
a government official drives the people to revolt (idiom); a minister provokes a rebellion by exploiting the people
hero/strong and courageous person/CL:條|条[tiao2]
to help those in distress (idiom)
chivalrous person/knight-errant
heroes

anxious to help others resolve difficulties (idiom)
